documents.document: @banbloodsports That's awful @DublinCoach1 - will you be doing this in future? If so, I know who not to book a coach journey with.
Both sides of Ranalagh bike lanes blocked, but it's OK as they had their hazards on. #freethecyclelanes https://t.co/L8AYblnJjT
@cosaingalway @feicphoto I bet she's on Twitter somewhere posting photos of the strange guy with the speed cameras
@MissEmmaJude Don't see anything particularly unique there - cycling advice seems to be written by someone with little clue of safe cycling
@paulageraghty Is full paper available anywhere?
@MissEmmaJude What is unique about that road then?
@MissEmmaJude Great idea, keep the mind closed good and tight there,
@MissEmmaJude Here's why single file isn't the safe option https://t.co/440dWth3bj Great learning opportunity
@suzybie @Lamhfada And many of the bits that are fully enacted are largely ignored
And you haven't yet managed to work out that the problem lies with your driving style @thejollyjammer ? @MissEmmaJude
@MissEmmaJude Same stuff comes up all over the world, anti-cycling rhetoric masked as 'safety concern'. Cyclists abreast safer than in line
@MissEmmaJude By not relevant, you mean it exposes your complaint as petty nonsense? Share the road, and we'll all get along.
@MissEmmaJude So overall, what % of your time is spent stuck behind cyclists vs stuck behind cars?
@MissEmmaJude Yes, picking one narrow, non-typical time/place scenarios is often hallmark of these 'complaints'. Context buddy, context.
@MissEmmaJude Again, not much sign of your claims of consideration coming through in your tweets. I wonder why?
@MissEmmaJude What % of your time is spent stuck behind cyclists vs stuck behind cars?
@MissEmmaJude Good for you, though targeting one group of vulnerable road users with complaints like this doesn't appear considerate?
@MissEmmaJude ALL roads can be enjoyable and safe with consideration. Do you often move over for cyclists?
@MissEmmaJude It's always funny when drivers who spend hours stuck in heavy traffic lose their reason when behind cyclist for a few seconds
@MissEmmaJude @SGHutch @thejollyjammer Do you move over to make room when a cyclist comes up behind you in busy urban traffic?
@MissEmmaJude @SGHutch @thejollyjammer Right, so it's not really 'very dangerous' then, just normal traffic.
@MissEmmaJude @SGHutch @thejollyjammer Are there many collisions or injuries arising from these "very dangerous" situations?
@healthwaveHQ Hi, is there any news on the 24 BP Monitor availability? Thanks
@TescoIrl But it is your bank I'm asking about, Tesco Bank Credit Card - when can I use this on Android Pay?
@AnnieAura @murf Give them a call https://t.co/iDVAuLgSg7
@TescoIrl I'm asking when Irish Tesco CC holders will be able to use PayQwig or Android Pay to make contactless payments with their phones?
@TescoIrl Thanks, just realised my question wasn't clear, I'm not asking about stores accepting these cards
@d12cyclist @derekfoley1980 @linef4ult @infofirehouse What is this Traffic Advisory group?
@fiveusa1 @ThePledge @graemelesaux14 @thecarolemalone So all road users should have the same rules, regardless of risk - is that it?
@fitzpatrickd Great progress, but a shame that you have to do this. Worth flagging to manufacturer and retailer?
@klillington @OliDuggan Could create a whole new business stream in supply of dummy phones and dummy friends
@ouninpohja9 @UrbnWarfareDuck @RSAIreland @Conorpope You're comparing apples and oranges, meaningless conclusion
Hey @TescoIrl, when will PayQwig or Android Pay be available to Irish CC card holders? Tks https://t.co/stla1V9ZaU
@ouninpohja9 @UrbnWarfareDuck @RSAIreland @Conorpope Meaningless to compare costs with comparing cost of living
@cosaingalway @IrishCycle @Cyclistie @MikeMcKillen @UrbnWarfareDuck At a guess, probably both refer to 'failed NCT'
@cosaingalway @IrishCycle @Cyclistie @MikeMcKillen @UrbnWarfareDuck @RSAIreland @ouninpohja9 @Conorpope FOI? What kind of info?
@ouninpohja9 How do you expect the Gardai to check suspension? Or brakes?
@WestHamLabour @forzagaribaldi @newhamcyclists Did anyone ask that member if he ever breaks a speed limit?
@LayaHealthcare Does this mean that families with 0 or 1 children are subsidising larger families?
@ohaolain @karenffurlong Good to see no baptism barrier - pleasant surprise
#rathminesbikelanecount 2 one loading into shop
@bicycletting Pretty much the same every time I get through that junction. The idea of showing consideration to others seems alien to most.
@karenffurlong WHat's the new policy @ohaolain ?
@AndrewHussey Might be worth reporting to the Regulator - they are usually very efficient at dealing with this stuff
@ddaly88 @kenfoxe @SeosamhMagAodha @LaceyDermot makes no sense. 'Per diem' rate is simple operational effeciency https://t.co/IyRSoz9cIL
@nightnurs3 I had to remove the Commun.it app - just too spammy for me.
@ddaly88 @kenfoxe @SeosamhMagAodha @LaceyDermot Problem is not 'unvouched' - problem is scale, purpose and lack of transparency
@ddaly88 @kenfoxe @SeosamhMagAodha @LaceyDermot Not every private expense is verified. Sales staff on the road often have unvouched exps.
#rathminesbikelanecount 1 - loading up furniture from older house in flats
@therealFBW @edspindrift @Andy_Watt @jongaunt But try reading the copper's tweet again, see if you can get the message 3rd time lucky
If I wanted to report you, I'd report you. I prefer to just call out your abuse, tks. @therealFBW @edspindrift @Andy_Watt @jongaunt

@therealFBW @edspindrift @Andy_Watt @jongaunt And no, I wasn't reporting you to copper, did you try reading linked tweet? Or
How come you're missing people killed and maimed by motorists on paths every week, Mark? @therealFBW @edspindrift @Andy_Watt @jongaunt
Look at actual data, not selective headlines Mark. You'll work out where real danger lies @therealFBW @edspindrift @Andy_Watt @jongaunt

@paulbmelia @cosaingalway And stab victims failed to wear stab vests, which puts them more at risk - so stab vests for all?
@therealFBW @Andy_Watt @jongaunt @talk2meradiouk Responsible cyclist and abusive tweeter with poor insight on safety https://t.co/Z5XOsQY07B
@Andy_Watt @therealFBW @jongaunt @talk2meradiouk was there once, nice place, don't see deaths by cyclists in Cambridge in gov stats, do you?
Are you able to discuss a topic without being abusive, Mark? @therealFBW @Andy_Watt @jongaunt @talk2meradiouk
Re: 'law there for ALL' Mark, do you every break a speed limit? Ever? @therealFBW @Andy_Watt @jongaunt @talk2meradiouk
Yes, cyclists kill 1-2 people a year in UK, while motorists kill 1k-2k pa, maim that x10 @therealFBW @Andy_Watt @jongaunt @talk2meradiouk
@Andy_Watt @therealFBW @jongaunt @talk2meradiouk In practice, most formal research into cause of collisions shows motorists generally cause
@Andy_Watt @therealFBW @jongaunt @talk2meradiouk In theory, sure, could happen, just like could happen with dogs or walkists or anyone 1/2
Though cyclists don't usually kill people on path, unlike motorists @Andy_Watt @therealFBW @jongaunt @talk2meradiouk https://t.co/Ir1CdBciGR
You have heard of dashcams, right @Andy_Watt? Lots of road users have cameras, cars, trucks, bikes... @therealFBW @jongaunt @talk2meradiouk
@Graham19985774 Would @jongaunt prioritise stopping drivers from killing pedestrians on path 1st? @bhamfascias https://t.co/Ir1CdBciGR
@paulsmithie07 those cyclists almost certainly paid motor tax for the motor they left sitting in their driveways while out for the spin 2/2
@paulsmithie07 No such thing, Paul. There is MOTOR tax, for motors, nothing to do with paying for roads. And funnily enough, 1/2
